meanings.definition: To look at something with one or both eyes partly closed in an attempt to see more clearly.
meanings.sent1: She squints in the bright sunlight to see the road ahead.
meanings.sent2: He always squints when reading small print to make the words clearer.
meanings.sent3: The detective squints at the clue, hoping to uncover hidden details.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the horizon squints into a golden blur.
meanings.sent5: The artist squints at the canvas, envisioning the final masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A condition in which the eyes are not properly aligned with each other, causing double vision.
meanings.sent1: His squints made it difficult for him to focus on objects in front of him.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with squints after noticing her eye alignment issue.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's exaggerated squints always made people laugh.
meanings.sent4: In the funhouse mirror, her reflection appeared as a series of squints.
meanings.sent5: The child's squints were corrected with the help of special glasses.
